evidence.source_document: Memorandum Opinion and Order Granting Petitioner Osorto's Ex Parte Application for Release from Immigration Custody
evidence.text: All terms found in the corpus are court-ordered (e.g., TRO terms, bond conditions, stipulations for motion withdrawal) and not settlement terms. The court-ordered terms include: 'the court orders that petitioner be released from custody upon the posting of a $5,000 bond, and with the condition that he be placed on location monitoring with an ankle monitor' (Memorandum Opinion, p.12) and 'Defendants shall be enjoined from conducting detentive stops... unless the agent has reasonable suspicion' (Order (002), p.20). The definition requires terms not entered as court orders, and no settlement agreements with substantive terms were found in any document.

The docket entries reference stipulations (e.g., 'STIPULATION to Withdraw Motion EX PARTE APPLICATION') but these are court procedural agreements, not settlement terms. No settlement agreement containing substantive obligations was present in any document.
